alert.note: Alert for Avoyelles; Evangeline; Rapides; St. Landry (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 3:28PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Rapides, northeastern Evangeline, Avoyelles and northeastern St. Landry Parishes through 415 PM CDT... At 328 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Deville to near Marksville to Hessmer to Bunkie to Bayou Chicot. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marksville, Bunkie, Simmesport, Melville, Moreauville, Palmetto, Bordelonville, Bayou Current, Morrow, Cottonport, Pine Prairie, Mansura, Hessmer, Evergreen, Plaucheville, Bayou Chicot, Goudeau, Lake Ophelia National Wildlife Refuge, Indian Lake and Whiteville. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 33 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for central Louisiana.
